info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 3:00PM EDT until May 25 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Chatham and Effingham and southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort and Jasper.
* WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 259 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated numerous showers and thunderstorms continue to develop across parts of Chatham, Effingham and Jasper Counties. As much as 1 to 3 inches of rain has fallen so far today and additional 1 to 2 inches could fall through 345 PM, resulting in minor flooding of urban and low-lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pooler, Bluffton, Savannah International Airport, Hutchinson Island, Downtown Savannah, Godley Station, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Bellinger Hill Area, Garden City and Port Wentworth.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Heavy rain in Downtown Savannah will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Chatham, GA; Effingham, GA; Beaufort, SC; Jasper, SC
